question: What project was Power Grid Corporation of India declared a successful bidder for?

question: What does the Khavda RE park project involve?
answer: The Khavda RE park project involves setting up a 765 400kV switching station at Vataman in Ahmedabad district, three 765kV D c transmission lines (including a LILO line) traversing in Gujarat, as well as extension works at Navsari and Halvad substations.
context: The project involves setting up a 765 400kV switching station at Vataman in Ahmedabad district three 765kV D c transmission lines (including a LILO line) traversing in Gujarat as well as extension works at Navsari and Halvad substations.

question: How did Power Grid Corporation of India's shares perform on December 1st, and what was the reason behind this performance?
answer: Power Grid Corporation of India's shares rose by 1% in early trading on December 1st. This increase was driven by the company's announcement that it had secured two interstate transmission system projects under a tariff-based competitive bidding process.
context: The provided text details the stock performance and recent business developments of Power Grid Corporation of India. On December 1st, the company's shares saw a 1% increase in early trading, reaching Rs 211.10. This positive movement was attributed to Power Grid Corporation of India being declared the successful bidder for two interstate transmission system projects. These projects, secured through a tariff-based competitive bidding process, involve the establishment of transmission infrastructure to evacuate power from the Rajasthan REZ PhIV (Part1) (Bikaner Complex).

question: What types of projects did Power Grid Corporation of India win, and how will they operate?
answer: Power Grid Corporation of India won two interstate transmission system projects. These projects will be executed on a build-own-operate-transfer (BOOT) basis.
context: Power Grid Corporation of India announced its successful bid for two interstate transmission system projects. These projects, won through a competitive bidding process based on tariffs, will operate under the build-own-operate-transfer (BOOT) model. This means Power Grid Corporation of India will be responsible for the financing, construction, ownership, and operation of these projects for a specified period, after which they will be transferred to a designated entity.

question: Can you describe the first transmission project that Power Grid Corporation of India will be undertaking?
answer: The first project involves building a transmission system to transport power from the Rajasthan REZ PhIV (Part 1) (Bikaner Complex) – Part A. This includes constructing a 765/400/220 kV Pooling Station at Bikaner III, two 400 kV D/C transmission lines, one 765 kV D/C transmission line within Rajasthan, and necessary bay extensions.
context: The initial project awarded to Power Grid Corporation of India focuses on establishing a robust transmission system to evacuate power from the Rajasthan REZ PhIV (Part 1) (Bikaner Complex) – Part A.  This project encompasses the construction of a crucial 765/400/220 kV Pooling Station at Bikaner III. Furthermore, it includes laying down two 400 kV D/C transmission lines and a 765 kV D/C transmission line, all within the state of Rajasthan. Essential bay extension works are also incorporated to ensure seamless power flow and grid stability.

question: What is the primary objective of the second transmission project secured by Power Grid Corporation of India?
answer: The second project aims to facilitate the efficient transmission of power from the Rajasthan REZ PhIV (Part 1) (Bikaner Complex) – Part D. This will involve the construction of a 765 kV D/C transmission line that will pass through Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh, along with associated bay extension works.
context: The second project secured by Power Grid Corporation of India centers around establishing a transmission system to evacuate power from the Rajasthan REZ PhIV (Part 1) (Bikaner Complex) – Part D.  This project involves building a 765 kV D/C Transmission Line that will traverse across Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh, ensuring efficient power transfer between these states. The project scope also includes necessary bay extension works to integrate this new transmission line with the existing grid infrastructure.

However, the EBITDA (Earnings before interest, tax, depreciation, and amortization) grew by 3.4% year-on-year to Rs 9099.5 crore.
